gaps_addressed:
UNCOMPLETED ROADMAP ITEMS for v0.8 (5):
  - Benchmark project #1: Simple CLI app (spec → working app in N iterations)
  - Benchmark project #2: REST API with database (spec → working app)
  - Benchmark project #3: Anima improves its own modules (self-improvement cycle)
  - Module health scoring (test coverage trend, change frequency, failure rate)
  - Auto-rewrite trigger: when module health drops below threshold
agent_output_excerpt:
Iteration #29 complete. Built **module health scoring** — the first v0.8 roadmap item.

**What was done:**
- Added 3 domain types to `domain/models.py`: `HealthStatus`, `ModuleHealthScore`, `HealthReport`
- Created `modules/module_health/` with CONTRACT.md, SPEC.md, `core.py`, and 14 tests
- `score_health()` computes per-module scores: 60% structural completeness (contract/spec/core/tests) + 40% runtime reliability (fallback rate from health.json)
- Classifies each module as HEALTHY (≥0.7), DEGRADED (≥0.4), or CRITICAL (<0.4)
- Integrated into `wiring.py` via `get_module_health()` with graceful fallback
- All 362 tests pass, 99% coverage, ruff + pyright clean

**v0.8 progress:** 1/5 items complete. Next up: auto-rewrite trigger (depends on this health scoring).
